intro: Panzerina lanata f. alaschanica, commonly known as the Alashan hairy panzerina, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in rocky and arid environments. Its distinctive morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and climate change, it faces significant threats to its survival.
